28.Name: Spectro Frazzle
28.Desc: Utilizes Spectro Frazzle for combat advantage

Name: Phoebe
Desc: Phoebe, <te href=850100>Acolyte</te> of the <te href=850099>Order of the Deep</te>, is a young woman of quiet devotion. With a kind heart, she fulfills her duties with unwavering diligence. Her prayers, like the light she carries, offer comfort and peace to all.

CharaInfo.Info: Phoebe, <te href=850100>Acolyte</te> of the <te href=850099>Order of the Deep</te>, is a young woman of quiet devotion. With a kind heart, she fulfills her duties with unwavering diligence. Her prayers, like the light she carries, offer comfort and peace to all.
CharaInfo.TalentDoc: [Excerpt of Letter of Recommendation from the Order Orphanage] The moment I saw the glowing Tacet Mark on her upper left thigh, I knew immediately that this was a blessing from Imperator. ...Her Resonance Ability allowed her to manifest light, refracting it into various forms of prisms. Even on the darkest nights, when the storm has snuffed out all other light, she fills every room with a soft, radiant glow. A light so comforting it conveys the very essence of hope in the darkest of times. As written in the Tenets of the Deep, such light must have always existed in her heart, a sign of her relentless devotion... *This record has been transferred from the Orphanage to the Order of the Deep's archives. We have reason to believe that Acolyte Initiate Phoebe's unparalleled Resonance ability stems from her unwavering faith in the Divinity. This is demonstrated by the rapport between her and the Echoes, a connection that has reinforced the trust some of our faithful have in her. Her active involvement in charitable works has already earned her recognition, therefore we have voted unanimously to grant her the title of Acolyte after her novitiate. However, some within the Order believe that her closeness with the Echoes violates the Order's doctrines. The blessings of the Divine Envoys are to be shared equitably, as the Sentinel's love for Their people is impartial and untainted by favoritism. Being too close to the Divine Envoys could lead to unforeseen risks. For this reason, we do not recommend her appointment to the Servitude Hall, and believe it would be most prudent to transfer her to the Ministry of Holy Rituals instead...
CharaInfo.TalentCertification: [Order of the Deep - Ministry of Holy Rituals Records] Resonator Phoebe's waveform graph displays elliptical fluctuations. The Time Domain pattern is stable, and no signs of abnormal fluctuations are observed. The test results fall within the normal phase range. Resonant Criticality: Relatively high. Resonator Phoebe's frequency displays high stability with a low risk of Overclocking. Records show no history of Overclocking. Acolyte Phoebe has always strictly adhered to the teachings of "silence" and "self-restraint," making her stability unmatched among her peers. Observations show that Acolyte Phoebe's Resonance ability produces a stable frequency, strongly affecting Echoes and Remnant Creatures. Humans can also be affected to a certain degree, experiencing "healing" on a spiritual level. This makes her particularly adept in roles that require soothing and mediation. *Latest Notes: A brief sawtooth fluctuation was detected in Acolyte Phoebe's regular waveform. No abnormalities have been noted at this time, but continued monitoring is advised, with increased attention if necessary.

Stories.Title: A Day in the Life of an Acolyte
Stories.Content:
On an ordinary afternoon, the wide streets of <te href=850097>Ragunna</te> bustled with people, more lively than in previous years.

The long-anticipated <te href=850102>Carnevale</te> was set to return, news that had already spread throughout Ragunna and even across the seas to distant shores. Over the past few days, travelers from all corners had appeared in the city. Even before dinner time, Trattoria Margherita was already packed with eager diners.

Ragunna's fine wines were as captivating as its breathtaking views. Nectarwine had the power to lull someone into a sweet dream, though overindulgence occasionally led to incidents.

What started as a small disagreement over taste soon escalated into a heated debate. Perhaps it was the weariness of restraint, or perhaps the sleepy afternoon simply needed a bit of excitement. Either way, more and more people gathered, joining the argument.

The debate grew fiercer and, in the end, exploded into a full-blown fistfight.

For a moment, the restaurant became a stage. Pizzas and desserts flew through the air, seafood leaped from plates and landed on the faces of passersby, and onlookers scrambled to hide, though many couldn't help but peek back to watch the chaos unfold. 

"Everyone! Oh, don't do that! You'll shatter the plates! Put down your cutlery, it's dangerous, you hear?" The owner cried out, her tail puffed up as she jumped up and down, waving a pizza paddle. Still, she was too afraid to get too close to the commotion.

Just then, a small figure darted from the crowd.

"Please, calm down!"

With a staff in hand, the little figure traced a wide arc through the air. A golden bird descended from the sky, seemingly carrying the weight of the heavens. It barely touched the two enraged men on their foreheads, like a dragonfly skimming the surface of a pond.

The two men, who had been at each other's throats just moments ago, instantly calmed and fell face-first onto the table with smiles, snoring softly.
 
"Don't worry, they've just fallen asleep," said the petite blonde <te href=850100>Acolyte</te> as she tucked away her staff, "However, disturbing public order is a violation of Order regulations. Those who disturb the peace must face appropriate punishment."

"Temperance is a virtue granted to us by the <te href=850083>Sentinel</te>. It makes both food and Nectarwine all the more delicious... I hope this little incident hasn't ruined anyone's enjoyment of their time here in Ragunna."

The Acolyte's smile was gentle and warm as the silence around her stretched on.
 
By the time more Acolytes arrived with La Guardia in tow, the commotion had already ended.

"Yes, yes, I saw it with my own eyes! She knocked out those two big guys with just one tap of her staff! Then, out of nowhere, a huge Plushie Echo appeared and carried them off! She looked young, but you can't judge a book by its cover..."

A diner, who had stayed behind to help clean up the aftermath, described the scene with no small amount of enthusiasm.

The lead Acolyte pulled out his Terminal to file a report, only to find that one had already been sent to the Order, detailing the incident and the whereabouts of the two who had been taken away.

"So... does that mean it's all taken care of?"

"Of course." The Acolyte put away his Terminal with certainty.

"Leave it to Acolyte Phoebe. She knows how to handle these things better than anyone."

Stories.Title: Home
Stories.Content: Dear Mr. Claremont, I apologize for the delay in reaching out. I have been caught up with an overwhelming number of matters. It is with a heavy heart that I must bring you this tragic news: Our business partner, the Marinos, were attacked by TDs during their journey to the New Federation. Unfortunately, they did not survive. May the Sentinel guide their spirits to peace. Regarding payment for the sunken cargo, as per our previous agreement, I have begun liquidating the remaining assets of the Marino family. It is a most reluctant measure. You and I both know how much we invested in that deal. Now, with nothing left to sustain it, I am left only with the task of trying to fill the void in the best way I can. You must remember Phoebe. The poor girl has lost her parents. She has nowhere to go, and as I am often away on business, I am unable to care for her as she deserves. I was told that you have a close relationship with a distant relative of the Marinos, and I pray you might consider offering her a home... I folded the letter carefully, checked the address once more, and knocked again. The repeated knocking had already drawn curious glances from the neighbors, but there was no response from within. The little girl stood quietly behind me, her head bowed, as if accustomed to such situations. "They went on a holiday a while back," a passing neighbor mentioned casually. "Might not be back for quite a while." "I see, thank you. Come on, Phoebe." As we turned to leave, I caught a glimpse of the curtain fluttering in the side window. I tightened my grip on Phoebe's hand, leading her away from the ostentatious neighborhood. Ragunna City was large, yet finding a home here was no easy task. I had lost count of how many doors I had knocked on, and how many times I had been turned away. After years of working in an orphanage, I had grown accustomed to all sorts of refusals, but I couldn't bear for Phoebe to experience this. She was still so young. What she needed was a warm, stable home, somewhere to heal in peace. "We're deeply sorry... You have our sympathy for the girl's misfortune, but you understand adopting a child is more than just adding another plate to the table... Here, this is the least we can give. We wish you the best of luck." "A letter? Ahem... I don't recall receiving any letter of this kind. Besides, didn't she already find a home at the orphanage? It's a fine place for children to live with others their age." "...I've heard that the Marinos still haven't paid off their debts. We'd rather not have creditors knocking on our door. Please understand." ... "Don't be sad, Sister Isabella." An ice cream was suddenly held out before me. A group of little Echoes had appeared around me unnoticed, each holding out ice creams and sweets meant for tourists. They were crowded around me, or rather, around Phoebe. "I know the grown-ups are busy, just like Mother and Father were. They always came home so late." I stared blankly at the melting ice cream, caught off guard by the fact that this tiny child was offering comfort to me. The Marino family, in their kindness, had helped the orphanage survive the worst of the Dark Tide. Yet here I stood, unable to find a proper home for their daughter. She should have been smiling in her parents' embrace, living a peaceful and happy life without worry. "It's okay, I can... live with everyone else. I'm happy being with everyone." When I remained silent for a long while, the young girl looked up at me and gave me a quiet, almost soothing smile. My heart trembled. "Everyone will stay together, right? Sister Isabella? The Acolytes tell us the Sentinel is always with us, keeping us together so we will never be apart." She recited the words with such certainty. In the end, I could only swallow the lump in my throat, hold back my tears, and pull her close. "All right... then let's go back. Let's go back home."

Stories.Title: Countless Nights
Stories.Content: The storm in the dead of night seemed as if it would drain every last drop of water in Ragunna. Lightning flashed across the sky, casting webbed shadows upon a young girl curled up in her blanket. Phoebe couldn't fall asleep. Every time she closed her eyes, she saw the churning, furious sea. There, a lone ship would never return home, and she was sinking with it. On nights like this, her father used to slip a locket with the Sentinel's portrait under her pillow, telling her that the Divinity would guide her through the storms in her dreams to a safe harbor. Her mother would place a bouquet of daisies by her bedside and tell her bedtime stories. She would say that the Sentinel sends Divine Envoys to protect brave and kind children like her. But now, the Acolytes would simply pat her head and tell her that she was like any other child. Every Rinascitan had to endure suffering before they could receive the Sentinel's forgiveness in the end. Once, when she peered over an Acolyte's shoulder, Phoebe caught sight of the magnificent statue of the Sentinel for the first time. The sight of the immense, sinuous fishtail gave her a moment of panic, but the Acolyte's gentle hand on her shoulder and the soft, steadying prayer helped calm her trembling heart. She was led into a warm, brightly lit room. The Acolytes treated her kindly, but she knew they probably preferred children who didn't bring trouble with them. Phoebe tried to remember the lullaby her mother used to sing, willing its melody to echo in her mind to drown out the howling storm outside. But still, the relentless thunder and rain dragged her back to that dark night. She had snuck aboard a merchant ship, peering through the porthole of the cargo hold to watch the distant horizon. When her parents returned, their sails would appear from that direction. She didn't want to wait for them anymore. This time, she was going to be brave and find them herself. But the sea wasn't as gentle as her mother described in her stories. She began to hear hurried footsteps on the deck, the noise growing frantic until screams pierced the air as the ship was tossed violently in the storm's grip. The vessel began to sink. Phoebe cried out for her parents, but the raging waves seemed to whisper that they would never return. The icy seawater engulfed her, and in her fading vision, she watched her father's locket disappear into the dark depths of the sea. When she opened her eyes again, she was lying on the shore, soaked to the bone. A Tacet Mark shone on her leg. The Acolytes who found her said no one could survive such a perilous sea, let alone a little girl. They believed it was a blessing from the Sentinel. But Phoebe faintly remembered that something had saved her. A presence so gentle, like a soft breeze, had lifted her to the surface and laid her gently on the shore, telling her… Don't be afraid. I'm here. Something pulled Phoebe from her dream. She felt the bed shift slightly, as though something soft and plush had nestled up beside her. It carried the dampness of the rain and the scent of daisies. Then Phoebe saw a pair of button eyes and soft, floppy ears—it was the stray Echo she had met in Whisperwind Haven earlier that day. She had untangled the kite string trapping it, naming it Brenno. Later, Brenno introduced Phoebe to many of its friends, took her cloud-watching on the hillsides, wiped away her tears, and even made her a wreath of pretty flowers. Don't be sad, Phoebe. The Plushie's body felt warm and soft. In the haze of sleep, Phoebe felt a faint, familiar presence. It felt like the wind. She buried her face into the Plushie's soft fur and slowly drifted back into a peaceful slumber.

Stories.Title: But Morning Came
Stories.Content:
As Phoebe woke up, she felt a lingering dampness at the corner of her eye.

"By the <te href=850083>Sentinel</te>'s grace, another day to rise and shine!"

She leaped out of bed and quickly smoothed the bed sheets. The small bed that had been a part of her childhood still looked as familiar as ever. Phoebe gave her cheeks a few quick pats to shake off the morning drowsiness before diving straight into the day's tasks. 

The orphanage was hosting a small celebration, and she had joined her senior <te href=850100>Acolyte</te> to help with the preparations. It would be her first time back since becoming an Acolyte Initiate. She had spent the previous evening talking with her brothers and sisters for a long while. Maybe that was why she had that dream about the past.

Everyone commented on how capable and grown she looked now. She couldn't afford to disappoint their expectations.

After morning prayers, Phoebe began preparing the necessary items for the celebration. The life of an Acolyte was busy yet fulfilling. For her, following a plan and seeing it come to fruition made her feel reassured and content. By the time the sun had climbed high in the sky, she and the other Acolytes had transformed the simple dining hall into a vibrant, colorful space. Phoebe set out the tea and snacks and watched the children, dressed in freshly laundered clothes pressed by the <te href=850082>Echoes</te>, rush excitedly into their caregivers' arms to receive their carefully wrapped presents.

Touched by this warm scene, Phoebe couldn't help but smile.

She remembered how her father would always buy her a present during the first stop of his business trips. How her mother would always come up with a story about the present. Sometimes they were thrilling adventures, other times gentle bedtime tales. Her favorite gift had been a pink rabbit stuffed toy. In the story, she was an elegant musician.

As the darker parts of her past faded away, Phoebe found herself remembering only the bright, happy moments.

A little Echo tugged on her sleeve, proudly showing her a big balloon it had just made. Instinctively, she reached out to pat its head.

"Acolyte Initiate Phoebe!"

Her senior's stern voice made Phoebe flinch. She quickly withdrew her hand and watched the Echo shuffle off with a hint of sadness. The senior's intense gaze seemed to pierce through her.

"By the Sentinel's grace, be mindful of your position."

...She still hadn't fully adjusted to her new role. As an Acolyte, she couldn't have close attachments to the Echoes.

The Sentinel had led her to kind people, given her food to eat and provided a roof over her head. With these gifts came new responsibilities. As an Acolyte, it was her duty to repay such kindness.

However, as Phoebe, she still had her own time to meet with friends.

Unconsciously, her hand went to the locket hanging around her waist. It was her own little miracle. A treasure that her friends had helped bring back from the depths of the sea.

"Ms. Phoebe, my balloon got stuck in the tree and I can't get it down. Jimmy said you can fly. Could you..."

"Of course!"

The child tugging at her clothes snapped Phoebe out of her reverie. She set aside her tangled thoughts and returned to the crowd, immersing herself in the busy work of the celebration once more.
 
As the sun began to dip lower in the sky, the evening colors slowly spread across the horizon.

The day's work was done, the crowd had dispersed, and everything fell into peaceful quiet. Phoebe sat on a bench, closing her eyes and letting the soft sea breeze wash over her. Time seemed to slow.

Her small figure appeared lonely against the setting sun. Her senior came looking for her, but noticing her shallow breathing realized that she had already fallen asleep. 

As the girl slept soundly on the bench, quiet little Echoes crept up from the sides and huddled close to her side. 

The older Acolyte sighed softly, turning away to leave her be.

"This time... I'll pretend I didn't see it."

Stories.Title: Within Distant Brilliance
Stories.Content:
Phoebe still had faint memories of the last <te href=850102>Carnevale</te> she had attended.

Sitting on her father's shoulders, she watched Wingrays soar overhead as bright streamers and petals fell like rain, the air filled with deafening cries. But those childhood memories were too hazy to hold onto. Now, whenever she thought of the Carnevale, all that came to mind was a soft glow and distant echoes.

Yet she still remembered the expressions on her parents' faces. Their laughter had come from the heart. Memories that once caused her pain now glimmered deep within her.

Scenes that had once lived only in her dreams now unfolded before her eyes.

She stood among the crowd, watching the dark-haired hero bathe in light as a golden wreath slowly descended, settling atop {Male=his;Female=her} head.

Her heart skipped a beat. Amidst the cheers, her gaze uncontrollably followed the golden light wherever it went.

"It's the <te href=850103>Laureate</te>!"

"Praise <te href=850105>Imperator</te>!"

"The <te href=850083>Sentinel</te> has sent us a miracle!"

Her vision blurred amid the tearful cries of joy.

Who wouldn't be moved by such a dazzling sight? Even the Divinity had bestowed a miracle for such a moment. At that instant, Phoebe couldn't help but wonder: how could the Sentinel be angered by the people celebrating the Carnevale? Surely, the Sentinel loved the Carnevale and the joy of the people.

The faint shadow that had loomed her heart since returning from the Atrium of Reflections resurfaced, only to be momentarily washed away by the singing and laughter.

But this time, Phoebe clung to that fleeting trace of doubt. The things she had noticed, but had pushed aside. The questions that had risen, but which she had instinctively avoided confronting.

Phoebe blinked hard, wiping away the tears at the corners of her eyes. She turned her gaze once again toward the figure surrounded by the crowd.

She had an inkling that {Male=he;Female=she} might hold the answers to clear her confusion.

And one day, she would seek out the truth behind that doubt.

Voices.Title: Thoughts: I
Voices.Content: Shhh.... how come you're all here? Ah, sorry {PlayerName}, didn't mean to disturb you. I just wanted to pay you a visit. Didn't expect these guys to tag along...

Voices.Title: Thoughts: II
Voices.Content: {PlayerName}, how did you meet Abby? Sorry, I don't mean to pry, it's just the two of you are inseparable, always looking out for each other, always trusting one another. It's wonderful, Abby must be... like family.

Voices.Title: Thoughts: III
Voices.Content: I know disciples of the Order should not form "attachments" to <te href=850082>Echoes</te>. But they're my dear friends, and that will never change. This must be one of the <te href=850083>Sentinel</te>'s trials, a test to see if I can fulfill my duties as an <te href=850100>Acolyte</te> while holding onto such... ties. It's a good test of my resolve. It's just, every time I see them, I want to hug them tightly... No, no, no, I must resist!

Voices.Title: Thoughts: IV
Voices.Content: You always seem so busy, but I hardly ever see you resting... Are you, perhaps, having trouble sleeping? If that's the case, I can help. Just a little tap with my staff and your mind will be at ease... Hmm? Where are you going? It won't hurt at all...

Voices.Title: Thoughts: V
Voices.Content: Balloons soaring into the bright blue sky, people and <te href=850082>Echoes</te> rejoicing under rainbows... When the <te href=850103>Laurel</te> was placed upon your head, I felt so happy. This <te href=850102>Carnevale</te> has been spectacular in every way, and it will remain etched in my heart forever.

Voices.Title: Phoebe's Hobby
Voices.Content: When I was little, I loved going to Whisperwind Haven with friends. We'd lie on slopes surrounded by flowers and watch the clouds drift by. Tilly would play their accordion, and Livia and Brenno would weave all sorts of garlands that left a wonderful scent in their wake. I still go back sometimes... in secret.

Voices.Title: Phoebe's Trouble
Voices.Content: I saw shadows where light could not reach. What if the path I once believed in so fervently was never the right one? Then... No, never mind. Please don't mind me...

Voices.Title: Favorite Food
Voices.Content: Something smells so good... It must be Miss Margherita's pizza cooked to perfection by Bakie... No, no, no, this month's Pizza Day already passed. What is Pizza Day you ask? It's the only day of the month we were allowed pizza at the orphanage. Even though I don't go hungry anymore, as an <te href=850100>Acolyte</te> I must resist gluttony.... Besides, the best pizza is one that's shared with friends.

Voices.Title: Disliked Food
Voices.Content: Everything we eat comes from the good earth created by the <te href=850083>Sentinel</te>. According to Them, "Our bodies are vessels for our souls." Therefore, we must sustain that vessel with things that are beneficial to it, such as those found in the sacred Viscum Berry. I still have a few left, would you like to try one? The Codex says sharing makes life sweeter...

Voices.Title: Ideals
Voices.Content: I hope for children to be by their parent's side. For sailors to return home after long voyages. For all to soar, free as birds. For people to come together despite their differences. For the <te href=850075>Lament</te> to not drive people apart... Huh? What do I hope for myself? I hope... I...

Voices.Title: Chat: I
Voices.Content: This locket was a gift from my father. I always thought it had sunk with that merchant ship, but here it is again in my hands. This itself is already a miracle... I cannot ask for more.

Voices.Title: Chat: II
Voices.Content: When I was a child, I awoke on a dark shore. I walked that shore for what felt like forever until I saw a light... a few kind <te href=850100>Acolytes</te> of the Order brought me to a brightly lit room. They fed me, sheltered me, and treated me well. Eventually, they became my adoptive family... Sometimes when the rain lashed out at night, Livia and Brenno would cuddle up next to me until I fell asleep. With them at my side... I never felt lonely.

Voices.Title: About Brant
Voices.Content: Mother once told me a story about an adventurer braving storms in search of freedom. When I saw Brant on stage, he reminded me of that adventurer, caring for naught while the ocean thrashes around him... Sometimes, I think Mr. Brant chooses to act out a life of equal parts comedy and tragedy.

Voices.Title: About Roccia
Voices.Content: Miss Roccia might appear ice cold, but at heart, I know she is a gentle and caring person. Her kindheartedness brings smiles to all those around her. And then there's her friend, <te href=850122>Pero</te>. I wonder if there's any chance Pero could also be my friend?

Voices.Title: About Cartethyia
Voices.Content: ...I once dreamt of a black sea, with swells growing larger and more violent. Amidst the spray, the Blessed Maiden appeared—or at least I think it was her. Something in that swaying silhouette resembled her, yet it also felt so unlike her...

Voices.Title: About Zani
Voices.Content: Not everyone in <te href=850097>Ragunna</te> worships the <te href=850083>Sentinel</te>. Certain <te href=850100>Acolytes</te> of the Order believe a person's worth is solely measured by their piety... But Miss Zani is brave and dependable, which just might be enough to overcome existing prejudices. After all, she's such a reliable and respectable person.

Voices.Title: Birthday Wishes
Voices.Content: Happy Birthday! Ooh... confetti! Just like how Mama and Papa used to celebrate. Here, take this, a bluebird set with aquamarine gemstones. A little something to be by your side through winds and storms. Like this statue, may your eyes always be bright, and may luck always be with you. Your path is not one ordained by the Sentinel, but one of your own making. And no matter where you go, I will always pray for you.

Voices.Title: Idle: I
Voices.Content: May Thy love endure forever, never ceasing.

Voices.Title: Idle: II
Voices.Content: Hm... Eh? Oh, there you are! Who's a good boy...

Voices.Title: Self-Introduction
Voices.Content: I'm Phoebe, an <te href=850100>Acolyte</te> of the <te href=850099>Order</te>. Praise the Sentinel. May They guide you to compassion and enlightenment.

Voices.Title: Join Team: II
Voices.Content: I resolve disputes in the <te href=850083>Sentinel</te>'s name.

Voices.Title: Join Team: III
Voices.Content: May the <te href=850083>Sentinel</te> guide those who are lost.

Voices.Title: Ascension: I
Voices.Content: The sparkling sea knows no bounds.

Voices.Title: Ascension: II
Voices.Content: Do I have what it takes to fight the forces of darkness?

Voices.Title: Ascension: III
Voices.Content: Your light has shown me a world I had never seen.

Voices.Title: Ascension: IV
Voices.Content: Thanks to you, my light will shine upon those in need.

Voices.Title: Ascension: V
Voices.Content: Held aloft by the rapids, I saw a golden glow... Your wisdom and grace have become gospel which I shall forever hold dear.

Voices.Title: Enemies Near
Voices.Content: Dark forces approach, be on guard.

Voices.Title: Supply Chest: I
Voices.Content: Cherish the gift not given lightly.

Goods.Title: Frozen In Time
Goods.Content:
A locket Phoebe carries with her, repurposed from an old pocket watch. Inside is a family portrait. 

It was lost to the depths of the sea during a shipwreck, but thanks to the tireless search of her kind friends, it was eventually returned to her.

"In the fleeting waves of time... in the beautiful spray of the sea, and in the light, there are words I want to tell you, over and over again."

Goods.Title: "Envoy"
Goods.Content:
A handcrafted souvenir from a land across the sea was the only item Phoebe kept when her family's possessions were sold off.

In the bedtime stories she once believed would never end, there was a bird with blue wings, the envoy of the Divinity. It had the power to cross through storms and bring happiness to the little girl who endured loneliness each night as she drifted to sleep.

Goods.Title: A Vision Far Away
Goods.Content: An old, faded edition of the Codex of the Deep, handbound by a loving and devout mother. A proper, dutiful Acolyte should be well-versed in the contents of the Codex, holding the Sentinel's guidance close to heart. Phoebe always adhered to the teachings in her heart, though, if truth be told, she preferred the color of the sky to that of the sea. "The Codex says that suffering brings us closer to the Divinity. But I still hope for a peaceful and happy life for you, my child."

SpecialCook.Name: A Slice of Pizza
SpecialCook.Desc: Increases Basic Attack DMG Bonus of all Resonators in the team by 44% for 30m. Only effective on your own Resonators in Co-op Mode.

Skill.Name: O Come Divine Light
Skill.Desc:
<size=40><color=Title>Basic Attack</color></size>
Perform up to 3 consecutive attacks of Holy Light, dealing <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color>.
<size=10> </size>
<size=40><color=Title>Heavy Attack</color></size>
Consume STA to attack the target, dealing <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color>.
<size=10> </size>
<size=40><color=Title>Mid-air Attack</color></size>
Consume STA to ride the staff and dive down from mid-air to attack the target, dealing <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color>.
<size=10> </size>
<size=40><color=Title>Mid-air Heavy Attack</color></size>
Consume STA to ride on the staff for a distance.
- Can be re-cast after a Mid-Air Dodge or using Grapple.
<size=10> </size>
<size=40><color=Title>Dodge Counter</color></size>
After a successful <color=Highlight>Dodge</color>, quickly use <color=Highlight>Basic Attack</color> to attack the target, dealing <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color>.
- When Phoebe is inside the <te href=850007>Ring of Mirrors</te>, Dodge Counter becomes <color=Highlight>Chamuel's Star: Dodge Counter</color>.
Skill.SimpleDesc:
<size=40><color=Title>Basic Attack</color></size>
Deal <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color>.
<size=10> </size>
<size=40><color=Title>Heavy Attack</color></size>
Deal <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color>.
<size=10> </size>
<size=40><color=Title>Mid-air Attack</color></size>
Consume STA to deal <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color>.
<size=10> </size>
<size=40><color=Title>Mid-air Heavy Attack</color></size>
Consume STA to ride on the staff for a distance.
<size=10> </size>
<size=40><color=Title>Dodge Counter</color></size>
Deal <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color>.

Skill.Name: To Where Light Shines
Skill.Desc:
Summon a Ring of Mirrors at the target location, making the target hit stagnate for {2}s and dealing <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color>. The stagnation effect can be applied to 12 targets max for each Ring of Mirrors. Using <color=Highlight>Resonance Skill</color> again shortly after the summoning teleports Phoebe to the Ring of Mirrors' location, dealing <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color>.
Unable to teleport if Phoebe is too far from the Ring of Mirrors.
<size=10> </size>
<size=40><color=Title>Ring of Mirrors</color></size>
- Ring of Mirrors lasts for {0}s. When Phoebe summons a new Ring of Mirrors, the existing Ring of Mirrors disappears.
- When Phoebe is outside of the Ring of Mirrors, a <color=Highlight>Basic Attack</color> or <color=Highlight>Dodge Counter</color> that hits the Ring of Mirrors will refract Holy Light, which deals <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color> to targets inside the <color=Highlight>Ring of Mirrors</color> and pulls the targets hit to the center of the ring. The DMG dealt is considered Basic Attack DMG. Can be triggered once every {1}s.
- When Phoebe is inside the Ring of Mirrors, <color=Highlight>Basic Attack</color> becomes Basic Attack <color=Highlight>Chamuel's Star</color>, which performs up to 3 consecutive attacks, dealing <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color>, considered Basic Attack DMG.
Skill.SimpleDesc:
Summon a Ring of Mirrors at the target location, making the target hit stagnate and dealing <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color>. Using <color=Highlight>Resonance Skill</color> again shortly after the summoning teleports Phoebe to the Ring of Mirrors' location, dealing <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color>.
<size=10> </size>
<size=40><color=Title>Ring of Mirrors</color></size>
- Ring of Mirrors lasts for {0}s. When Phoebe summons a new Ring of Mirrors, the existing Ring of Mirrors disappears.
- When Phoebe is outside of the Ring of Mirrors, a <color=Highlight>Basic Attack</color> or <color=Highlight>Dodge Counter</color> that hits the Ring of Mirrors will deal extra DMG and pull the targets hit to the center of the <color=Highlight>Ring of Mirrors</color>.
- When Phoebe is inside the Ring of Mirrors, <color=Highlight>Basic Attack</color> becomes Basic Attack <color=Highlight>Chamuel's Star</color>, dealing <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color>.

2.Name: Ring of Mirrors: Refracted Holy Light DMG

Skill.Name: Dawn of Enlightenment
Skill.Desc:
Phoebe concentrates the light in her hands into the Mirror of Enlightenment and smashes it, dealing <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color>.
- <color=Highlight>Absolution</color> Enhancement: Increase DMG Multiplier by {0}.
- <color=Highlight>Confession</color> Enhancement: Apply <SapTag=1>{1}</SapTag> {Cus:Sap,S=stack P=stacks SapTag=1} of <color=Highlight><te href=850008>Spectro Frazzle</te></color> to targets hit.
Skill.SimpleDesc:
Deal <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color>.
- <color=Highlight>Absolution</color> Enhancement: Increase DMG Multiplier.
- <color=Highlight>Confession</color> Enhancement: Apply <color=Highlight>Spectro Frazzle</color> to targets hit.

Skill.Name: Presence
Skill.Desc: Mid-air Heavy Attack can be cast <SapTag=0>{0}</SapTag> more {Cus:Sap,S=time P=times SapTag=0}.
Skill.SimpleDesc: Mid-air Heavy Attack can be cast <SapTag=0>{0}</SapTag> more {Cus:Sap,S=time P=times SapTag=0}.

Skill.Name: Revelation
Skill.Desc: When in the <color=Highlight>Absolution</color> status and <color=Highlight>Confession</color> status, Spectro DMG Bonus is increased by {0}.
Skill.SimpleDesc: When in the <color=Highlight>Absolution</color> status and <color=Highlight>Confession</color> status, Spectro DMG Bonus is increased by {0}.

Skill.Name: Golden Grace
Skill.Desc: Knock back nearby targets and deal <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color>.

Skill.Name: Radiant Invocation
Skill.Desc:
When Phoebe's Prayer is full, consume all Prayer to cast one of the following skills:
- Hold <color=Highlight>Basic Attack</color> to cast Heavy Attack <color=Highlight>Absolution Litany</color>, dealing <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color> and applying {0} stack of <color=Highlight><te href=850008>Spectro Frazzle</te></color> to the targets hit. Phoebe enters <color=Highlight>Absolution</color> status, which allows her to deal more damage.
- Hold <color=Highlight>Resonance Skill</color> to cast Resonance Skill <color=Highlight>Utter Confession</color>, dealing <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color> and applying {0} stack of <color=Highlight>Spectro Frazzle</color> to the targets hit. Phoebe enters <color=Highlight>Confession</color> status, which allows her to better exploit Spectro Frazzle.
- <color=Highlight>Absolution</color> and <color=Highlight>Confession</color> cannot coexist. Entering into one will end the other.
- When Divine Voice is not exhausted, Phoebe is unable to cast Heavy Attack <color=Highlight>Absolution Litany</color> and Resonance Skill <color=Highlight>Utter Confession</color>.
- When Divine Voice is exhausted, Phoebe will not exit the <color=Highlight>Absolution</color> or <color=Highlight>Confession</color> status.
<size=10> </size>
<size=40><color=Title>Heavy Attack: Starflash</color></size>
When Phoebe has Divine Voice, casting <color=Highlight>Basic Attack Stage 3</color> or <color=Highlight>Dodge Counter</color> replaces the next <color=Highlight>Heavy Attack</color> with <color=Highlight>Heavy Attack: Starflash</color>, which deals <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color> at the cost of {2} Divine Voice.
- <color=Highlight>Absolution</color> Enhancement: Reduce the cost of Divine Voice by {3}. When the targets hit have <color=Highlight>Spectro Frazzle</color>, the skill gains {4} DMG Amplification.
- <color=Highlight>Confession</color> Enhancement: Apply {5} stacks of <color=Highlight>Spectro Frazzle</color> to the targets hit.
<size=10> </size>
<size=40><color=Title>Prayer </color></size>
Phoebe can hold up to {6} Prayer.
Phoebe automatically gains {7} Prayer every second.
<size=10> </size>
<size=40><color=Title>Divine Voice</color></size>
Phoebe can hold up to {8} Divine Voice.
Casting Heavy Attack <color=Highlight>Absolution Litany</color> or Resonance Skill <color=Highlight>Utter Confession</color> restores {9} Divine Voice.
Skill.SimpleDesc:
When Phoebe's Prayer is full, consume all Prayer to cast one of the following skills:
- Hold <color=Highlight>Basic Attack</color> to cast Heavy Attack <color=Highlight>Absolution Litany</color>, dealing <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color> and applying <color=Highlight>Spectro Frazzle</color> to the targets hit. Phoebe enters <color=Highlight>Absolution</color> that focuses more on dealing direct DMG.
- Hold <color=Highlight>Resonance Skill</color> to cast Resonance Skill <color=Highlight>Utter Confession</color>, dealing <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color> and applying <SapTag=0>{0}</SapTag> {Cus:Sap,S=stack P=stacks SapTag=0} of <color=Highlight>Spectro Frazzle</color> to the targets hit. Phoebe enters <color=Highlight>Confession</color> that focuses more on Spectro Frazzle.
<size=10> </size>
<size=40><color=Title>Heavy Attack: Starflash</color></size>
When Phoebe has Divine Voice, casting <color=Highlight>Basic Attack 3</color> or <color=Highlight>Dodge Counter</color> replaces the next <color=Highlight>Heavy Attack</color> with <color=Highlight>Heavy Attack: Starflash</color>, which deals <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color> at the cost of {2} Divine Voice.
- <color=Highlight>Absolution</color> Enhancement: Reduce the cost of Divine Voice by {3}. When the targets hit have <color=Highlight>Spectro Frazzle</color>, the skill deals more DMG.
- <color=Highlight>Confession</color> Enhancement: Apply <color=Highlight>Spectro Frazzle</color> to the targets hit.
<size=10> </size>
<size=40><color=Title>Prayer </color></size>
Phoebe can hold up to {6} Prayer.
Phoebe automatically gains {7} Prayer every second.
<size=10> </size>
<size=40><color=Title>Divine Voice</color></size>
Phoebe can hold up to {8} Divine Voice.
Heavy Attack <color=Highlight>Absolution Litany</color> or Resonance Skill <color=Highlight>Utter Confession</color> restores Divine Voice.

Skill.Name: Attentive Heart
Skill.Desc:
Deal <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color> equal to {0} of Phoebe's ATK to nearby targets.
- <color=Highlight>Absolution</color> Enhancement: Increase DMG Multiplier by {1}.
- <color=Highlight>Confession</color> Enhancement: Grant <color=Highlight>Silent Prayer</color> to the Resonator on the field, reducing the Spectro RES of nearby targets by {2} and granting {3} <color=Highlight><te href=850008>Spectro Frazzle</te></color> DMG Amplification. When <color=Highlight>Spectro Frazzle</color> inflicts DMG, extend <color=Highlight>Spectro Frazzle's</color> damage interval by {4}. This effect lasts {5}s or until Phoebe switches to <color=Highlight>Absolution</color> status.
Skill.SimpleDesc:
Deal <color=Light>Spectro DMG</color> equal to {0} of Phoebe's ATK.
- <color=Highlight>Absolution</color> Enhancement: Increase DMG Multiplier.
- <color=Highlight>Confession</color> Enhancement: Reduce the Spectro RES of targets in a certain range by {2} and grant {3} <color=Highlight>Spectro Frazzle</color> DMG Amplification. When <color=Highlight>Spectro Frazzle</color> inflicts DMG, extend <color=Highlight>Spectro Frazzle's</color> damage interval by {4}. This effect lasts {5}s or until Phoebe switches to <color=Highlight>Absolution</color> status.

Skill.Name: Tune Break: Rectifier
Skill.Desc: When the target's <color=Highlight>Off-Tune Level</color> is full, the Resonator may cast <color=Highlight><te href=100001>Tune Break</te></color> on the target.
Skill.SimpleDesc: When the target's <color=Highlight>Off-Tune Level</color> is full, the Resonator may cast <color=Highlight><te href=100001>Tune Break</te></color> on the target.

1.Name: Warm Light and Bedside Wishes
1.Desc:
When in <color=Highlight>Absolution</color>, Resonance Liberation <color=Highlight>Dawn of Enlightenment</color> now increases DMG Multiplier by {1} instead of {0}. 
When in <color=Highlight>Confession</color>, Resonance Liberation <color=Highlight>Dawn of Enlightenment </color> increases DMG Multiplier by {2} and applies <color=Highlight><te href=850008>Spectro Frazzle</te></color> to the targets with the maximum stack the targets can receive.

2.Name: A Boat Adrift in Tears
2.Desc:
When in <color=Highlight>Absolution</color>, DMG dealt by Outro Skills to targets with <color=Highlight><te href=850008>Spectro Frazzle</te></color> is Amplified by {0}.
When in <color=Highlight>Confession</color>, <color=Highlight>Silent Prayer</color> grants {1} more DMG Amplification for <color=Highlight>Spectro Frazzle</color>.

3.Name: Daisy Wreaths and Dreams
3.Desc:
When in <color=Highlight>Absolution</color>, the DMG Multiplier of Heavy Attack <color=Highlight>Starflash</color> is increased by {0}.
When in <color=Highlight>Confession</color>, the DMG Multiplier of Heavy Attack <color=Highlight>Starflash</color> is increased by {1}.

4.Name: Ringing Bells on Wings Aloft
4.Desc: When <color=Highlight>Basic Attack</color>, Basic Attack <color=Highlight>Chamuel's Star</color>, <color=Highlight>Dodge Counter</color>, or <color=Highlight>Chamuel's Star: Dodge Counter</color> hits, the target's Spectro RES is reduced by {0} for {1}s.

5.Name: Prayer to the Distant Light
5.Desc: Casting Intro Skill <color=Highlight>Golden Grace</color> increases Phoebe's Spectro DMG Bonus by {0} for {1}s.

6.Name: Whispering Chirps in Silence
6.Desc:
Targets entering the <te href=850007>Ring of Mirrors</te> are stagnated for an additional {0}s. The stagnation effect affects all targets entering the Ring of Mirrors and can be applied to 12 targets max for each Ring of Mirrors. Each target will only be affected by this effect once.
When in <color=Highlight>Absolution</color> or <color=Highlight>Confession</color>, summoning a <te href=850007>Ring of Mirrors</te> with <color=Highlight>Resonance Skill</color> increases Phoebe's ATK by {1} for {2}s, and triggers an extra Heavy Attack <color=Highlight>Starflash</color> at the Ring of Mirrors' location. This Heavy Attack <color=Highlight>Starflash</color> does not consume <te href=850014>Divine Voice</te> and is not considered as casting a <color=Highlight>Heavy Attack</color>.

81001506.Name: Phoebe
81001506.BgDescription: Phoebe's memories are always tinged with a shade of blue. The bird that soared from her childhood bedtime stories, the robes of the Acolytes who offered her sanctuary, and the gentle breeze that carried her out of her darkest dreams.

150601.Desc: Heavy Attack - Starflash: When Phoebe is in Absolution or Confession status, hold {0} after performing Basic Attack 3 to attack the target at the cost of Divine Voice. When in Absolution, Phoebe deals greater damage while consuming less Divine Voice. When in Confession, Phoebe applies Spectro Frazzle to the targets hit.

150602.Desc: Resonance Skill: {Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} Resonance Skill to summon a Ring of Mirrors to pull in targets and stagnate them. {Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} {0} within limited-time to teleport to the Ring of Mirrors. Phoebe has different Basic Attack movesets in and out of the Ring of Mirrors.

DescList: When Prayer is full, choose to enter either Absolution or Confession.

Hold Normal Attack to enter the Absolution status, dealing greater damage.
Hold Resonance Skill to enter the Confession status, applying Spectro Frazzle to targets hit.
